Texto: 
normal
no treatment required.  since some cases of cavernous malformation are hereditary, recommended follow up studies to include gradient echo mr sequence to look for additional lesions.
mr images demonstrate a well delineated complex core of mixed signal intensities with a low signal hemosiderin rim; and, with enhancement of the medial aspect of the core after contrast administration.
cavernous malformation
• cavernous angioma (cavernous malformation)
• venous angioma
• arteriovenous malformation
• capillary telangectasia
• hemorrhagic neoplasm
56 year-old woman with worsening headaches.
see topic
